posts.cooked: Unable to Download Python compiled for roboRIO using command “robotpy sync”

posts.name: Joe Ross
posts.cooked:
Are you connected to the internet when running the sync command?

Are you able to download this file? It’s what’s failing to download. It could be blocked by a proxy or a firewall or something. https://github.com/robotpy/roborio-python/releases/download/2024-3.12.1-r1/python312_3.12.1-r1_cortexa9-vfpv3.ipk

The network is successfully connected when running the synchronization command. I tried changing the network, changing the proxy, etc., but it still couldn’t be solved. IPK files can be downloaded normally using github connection.

posts.name: Davo
posts.cooked: If you’re behind a proxy, it’s possible robotpy-installer currently doesn’t use the system proxy settings. I haven’t verified this though.
I have tried resetting the network and canceling the proxy, but the installation cannot be successful.

posts.name: Dustin Spicuzza
posts.cooked: The code for downloading files is at robotpy-installer/robotpy_installer/utils.py at 5752b3153538409d448761294b528dc05a46c5fb · robotpy/robotpy-installer · GitHub . I’m not sure if it supports proxies or not, but if you can modify it to accept a proxy I’m happy to accept a PR.
Thanks for the reply, I’ll try it. If there is really no other way, I will try to contact the ISP to restart the system.

posts.name: system
posts.cooked: This topic was automatically closed 365 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.

suggested_topics.title: Robotpy deploy can't find "robotpy" file
suggested_topics.excerpt: According to the documentation, the command you need to run is py -3 -m robotpy deploy, so you’re just missing the -m.
